title: How to Make a Layered Chocolate Syrup Bread Sandwich Pastry

steps.headline: Choose your favorite type of bread.
steps.description: Consider using raisin or fruit bread for better flavor and so it goes better with the chocolate syrup. Each small pastry typically takes three slices of bread, making a three-layer pastry. If you want there to be more layers, then the pastry can have four or five layers. It is the "chef's choice" (your choice).

steps.headline: Cut the bread.
steps.description: Make the slices square or diamond shaped, ensuring that all three are cut to the same size.

steps.headline: "Frost" the bread with chocolate syrup.
steps.description: Take the bread slice one by one and spread chocolate syrup on both sides.

steps.headline: Melt a cheese cube.
steps.description: Apply it on top of the layers of chocolate, covering only the inner layers of the sandwich. Exclude the bottom and top.

steps.headline: Stack the slices of bread.
steps.description: Make a three-layered sandwich by placing each slice on top of each other. Put the layers into a container or on a plate lined with waxed paper, or sprayed lightly with cooking spray. Be sure to press the layers together gently, but firmly with a spatula or wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Frost the pastry.
steps.description: Apply two to three coats of chocolate syrup on the top and sides of the bread pastry sandwich, covering it completely.

steps.headline: Decorate the pastry.
steps.description: Consider using almonds, cashew nuts or roasted peanuts. You can also add fresh or dried fruit or colorful cherries.

text: Choose your favorite type of bread. Consider using raisin or fruit bread for better flavor and so it goes better with the chocolate syrup. Each small pastry typically takes three slices of bread, making a three-layer pastry. If you want there to be more layers, then the pastry can have four or five layers. It is the "chef's choice" (your choice). Cut the bread. Make the slices square or diamond shaped, ensuring that all three are cut to the same size. "Frost" the bread with chocolate syrup. Take the bread slice one by one and spread chocolate syrup on both sides. Melt a cheese cube. Apply it on top of the layers of chocolate, covering only the inner layers of the sandwich. Exclude the bottom and top. Stack the slices of bread. Make a three-layered sandwich by placing each slice on top of each other. Put the layers into a container or on a plate lined with waxed paper, or sprayed lightly with cooking spray. Be sure to press the layers together gently, but firmly with a spatula or wooden spoon. Frost the pastry. Apply two to three coats of chocolate syrup on the top and sides of the bread pastry sandwich, covering it completely. Decorate the pastry. Consider using almonds, cashew nuts or roasted peanuts. You can also add fresh or dried fruit or colorful cherries. Freeze the pastry. Serve frozen. Finished.
